title: Cost of Living
description: This Geo Visualization shows how much does it cost to live in the United States. The Data is taken from the monthly Basic Allowance for Housing (BAH) for new recruits in the military.

title: Bad English Diary
description: A book about how one girl who immigrated to the U.S. with no prior English skills learned English by keeping a diary written in Bad English. The book transcribes the diary entries with corrections for how to write it in proper English instead.

title: 10 Best Things I did before I turned 25
description: An article I wrote for Medium (published 2/24/16), in which I reflect on all the things I accomplished before the age of 25.

title: A breakdown of a military officer's monthly salary
description: This pie chart visualization provides an overview of the different sources of money that compose my monthly salary.

title: Interactive Data Presentation
description: A presentation on how data visualization can be used for better story telling and decision making.

title: Why President Trump Will Bring Positive Change To America
description: A story about how the two-party system is more of a problem to America's democratic process than Donald Trump becoming the next problem

title: How Learning To Play The Piano Taught Me Math
description: In this article, I introduce a pattern I discovered in adding and subtracting natural numbers and a finger counting technique, inspired by piano fingering and my experiences learning how to play the piano.

title: LooseLeaf
description: A social media platform for online education

title: NumberShapes
description: Mobile Apps for learning arithmetics I and Andrew created.

title: Startup Canvas for LooseLeaf
description: What LooseLeaf is about in an image - includes descriptions on the product, unique marketable elements, key message, target audience, and audience Influencer. Inspired by Jon Westenberg's article.

title: Jill Bolte Taylor's stroke of insight
description: How the brain works and various insights about artificial intelligence from the experience of a neuroscientist who suffered from a stroke

description: Data in health, economy, work, population, disease etc ready for visualization

title: The death of democracy: Daylin Leach at TEDxPhoenixville
Our democracy no longer represents the people
description: Larry Lessig talks about how an average American's vote carries little to no weight in effecting change. Issues with Gerrymandering, party membership cost and donations are discussed.

title: Storytelling using data visualization
description: Lam Ghuy Vo gives this talk on constructing active storytelling using data visualization. Insight gained from this talk includes the various story telling format, including Chronological (time), logical, and spatial/location proximity.

title: Open data driven policies
description: Ben Wellington talks about how public decision making should be more data-driven and how data visualization can be used to make public data more accessible to people.

title: Don't learn to code. Learn to think.
description: Coding is not about memorizing syntax. It's about problem solving.

description: My response to a question asked on Engineer Girl about what it takes to be a software engineer and a programmer

description: I responded a question on Engineer Girl and provided some tips about the process and choices one needs to make starting from High School to become a female engineer

description: A comic from the Oatmeal which explains how net neutrality works. This is apparently a response to a tweet by Ted Cruz. One of the most educational and entertaining Infographics I have ever seen.

title: If Programming Languages Were Essays
description: Metaphor for programming languages. Funny Comic.

description: Techies is a portrait project created to share stories of tech employees in Silicon Valley.

title: Freemium business model lecture
description: Chris Anderson, the author of "Free: The Future of a Radical Price", discusses the freemium business model (give away 90% of your stuff for free and upsell the remaining 10% to the power users).  There other kinds of economies besides the monetary economy, for example, the time economy (people pay to save time) and the reputation economy.

description: Why Entrepreneurship is hard and how a virtual community for mentorship can help.

title: Integrate D3 with React
description: Both libraries manipulates the DOM. Takeaway is that D3 should not be able to manipulate a DOM element that React created. But do the elements D3 require React's DOM reconciliation?

title: Ingredients of a successful startup pitch
